text: Pours opaque dark chocolate brown with a good tan head. Aroma features tones of molasses, roast malt and chocolate. Flavor echoes the aroma while tossing in some toffee. Mouthfeel presents firm body and peppy fizz. Logically Byzantine.

500 ml bottle via trade. Pours a deep, dark, opaque brown with a finger of soft, frothy tan head that settles into a thick ring and just a wee bit of film around the edge of the liquid, attached to the ring. So this is definitely showing a hint of tart dark fruit, which sucks, because the rest of it seems like itd be great. Candied nuts, marshmallow, coconut, chocolate, vanilla, whiskey, oak, mild roast - the sour fruit is subtle, but its there. Finishes with a big, sweet warm boozy note, and just a wee bit of the off note underneath it all. Full-bodied, with moderate carbonation. Man. Fuck. This wouldve been a classic, I can just tell. Which redeems this, because even with the off note, its not bad. Oh well. I hope they do it again so I can get a good one.
Bottle - pours black tan head - nose/taste of walnut, pistachio, chocolate, bourbon, oak and light hazelnut - medium body
Bottle. Dark pour with light head. Super nutty, walnut, cashew, pistachio, chocolate aromas. Flavors are sweet and nutty, walnut, cashew, pistachio, some chocolate, roasted tones.

Draft to snifter at the week of logic festival. Black with a thin tan head. Aroma is nutty, pistachio and walnut. Taste is straight up eastern European pastry, baklava or patitza. Nutty, brown sugar and doughy sweetness. Some honey sweetness on the finish that becomes stronger as it warms. Unique beer that is really enjoyable.
Draft @ the brewery. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate nutty aroma. Roasted malty chocolate nutty flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate nutty finish.
Great beer. Good looking beer with a huge aroma of hazelnuts, chocolate, and bread. Flavor is identical to the nose nutty, chocolate, breads malts. Nice sweetish finish. Well done
Bottle thanks to Rey. Pours black with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is roast, pure sugar, nuts, dark fruit. Medium body, roasted malt, dark chocolate, hazelnut, boozy finish, very nice.

Bottle acquired in trade... Dark brown pour with tan head... Aroma of honey, chocolate, nuts.... Flavor is sweet honey, chocolate, walnuts, pistachios, sticky caramel, some nuts on finish... maybe some vanilla from barrel, flavors come out more as it warms... delicious!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle @ Uiltje bar, thanks Patrick Verhoeven for providing these! Black color. Dense light brown head, not much. Aromas: bourbon, sweet, pistachio, vanilla. Retronasal its bourbon, pistachio, sweet, alcoholic. Flavor is very sweet, sweet stout, honey. Rather full bodied, sticky and oily. Quite low carbonation. Long finish, the pistachio getting stronger. Very nice, if you can get past the sweetness. Good dessert beer.

Bottle shared at Uiltje Bar 2nd Anniversary. Black with a ring beige head. Aroma of chocolate brownies, chocolate fudge, milk chocolates, bourbon, caramel, vanilla, toffee, nuts and woody notes. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Lovely!

Sampled at Uiltje Bars Anniversary, 2017. Dark brown pour with a very thin tan head. Notes of walnuts, pecan nuts, caramel, dried sweet fruit, vanilla, brownies, chocolate muffins, a bit of mouldy cellar, rum, sherry. Wow, I did not expect a Baltic porter to taste like this. Smooth oily texture, low carbonation.

26 Jan 2017, tap at Bottle Logic. Black. Nose is crazy! It smells just like baklava. I can smell pistachio, honey, and the crispy pastry. Ned body and mildly fizzy. Very sweet, lots of honey, pistachio. Wow.
